content.question:
Pectinase is a protein that catalyzes the breakdown of pectic polysaccharides in plant cell walls. A researcher designs an experiment to investigate the effect of salinity on the ability of pectinase to lower the activation energy of the reaction involved. The design of the experiment is presented in Table 1. For each test tube, the researcher will measure the amount of product formed over 20 minutes.

Table 1. An experiment to investigate the effect of salinity on pectinase function

Test Tube 
Sodium Chloride Concentration (molar) 
Temperature (degrees C) 
Substrate Added 
Pectinase Added

Yes 

Which of the following statements best helps justify the inclusion of test tube 5 in the experiment?

choices.label: It will act as a control for test tube 4 by showing the effect of the presence or absence of the substrate.
It will act as a control for test tube 4 by showing the effect of a change in environmental temperature.
It will act as a control for test tube 6 by showing the effect of the presence or absence of the enzyme.
It will act as a control for test tube 6 by showing the effect of a change in sodium chloride concentration.

content.answer: It will act as a control for test tube 6 by showing the effect of the presence or absence of the enzyme.

skill.text: 3.C: Identify experimental procedures that align with the question, including: i. identifying dependent and independent variables ii. identifying appropriate controls iii. justifying appropriate controls
